definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.english: The false performance record drove up the stocks of WorldCom and won it great acclaims from the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 虚假的业绩使世通的股票上涨，股市一片赞誉。

sentences.english: Former minister of Ministry of Water Resources Zhang Zhenhuai praises the school as "the cradle of Yellow River technical leaders".
sentences.chinese: 水利部原部长杨振怀赞誉学院为“黄河技干摇篮”。

sentences.english: Moviegoers across the island have said nothing but good things about the latest Madonna movie.
sentences.chinese: 全岛的观众对麦丹娜最近的一部赞誉有加。

sentences.english: When she praised a book, it will become a best-seller.
sentences.chinese: 她每赞誉一本书，这本书一定会畅销。

sentences.english: Fine accolades from a horseman of Bob Battaglia's distinction.
sentences.chinese: 从骑手鲍勃巴塔利亚的区别精细的赞誉。

sentences.english: The interviewer said that my references were full of praise.
sentences.chinese: 面试官说我的介绍信里满是赞誉之词。

sentences.english: Route the project becomes the masses Jiao Kou praise "popular feelings project".

sentences.english: Red has been praised for its nobility as the colour of life.
sentences.chinese: 红色因为它的高贵而被赞誉为生命的颜色。

sentences.english: The immortal word does, and praises Wuhan is "place of the white clouds yellow crane".
sentences.chinese: 的不朽词作，并赞誉武汉为“白云黄鹤之地”。

sentences.english: Mr. Jiang has won plaudits for his direct style.
sentences.chinese: 姜建清因其直截了当的风格而赢得了赞誉。

sentences.english: It is widely credited as the spark that began the personal computer revolution.
sentences.chinese: 这就是广受赞誉的开启了个人计算机革命的火花。

sentences.english: Not all of Japan's cultural exports have won praise.
sentences.chinese: 但并非所有的日本文化输出都受到赞誉。

sentences.english: He has been feted as a great thinker.
D. Gann will receive full recognition as one of Wall Street's leading operators. R. D.
sentences.chinese: 江恩就会以华尔街领军人物之一的身份广受赞誉。

sentences.english: Henceforth, Paise is that a "bright city " praise has spread over.
sentences.chinese: 此后，佩斯是一个“光明城市”的赞誉就传开了。

sentences.english: After his office won the conviction of Rajaratnam, Bharara was lauded far and wide.
sentences.chinese: 在拉贾拉特南被定罪之后，巴拉拉赢得了广泛的赞誉。

to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
voices unanimous in praise (idiom); with an extensive public reputation
